intro: Cryptantha leptophylla, commonly known as the slender-leaf cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, adapted to conserve water in arid environments. Cryptantha leptophylla is an important plant for pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its native range.
